item.title: Disillusionment of the American Dream
item.description: Is the theme of the “American Dream’s demise” in The Great Gatsby an isolated case or a widespread phenomenon in real American society? The theme of the “disillusionment of the American Dream” in The Great Gatsby is not an isolated case but rather a widespread phenomenon in real American society. While the American Dream represents the ideal of achieving wealth, success, and happiness through personal effort, many factors in reality make this dream difficult to attain or only accessible to certain groups.

item.title: The Collision Between Gatsbys Ideal and Reality
item.description: The collision between Gatsby’s ideal and reality–Expand on this sentence in one paragraph It was this night that he told me the strange story of his youth with Dan Cody—told it to me because ‘Jay Gatsby’ had broken up like glass against Tom’s hard malice and the long secret extravaganza was played out. This sentence reflects one of the core conflicts in The Great Gatsby: the collision between Gatsby’s ideals and reality.
